ygData.subject: Re: Tinkering Cap
ygData.msgSnippet: Eh. I actually like the cap. It means that a gnome that is a master tinkerer has WORKED for it.. it s not some level 16 that was powerleveled by his guild and
ygData.messageBody:
Eh. I actually like the cap. It means that a gnome that is a master tinkerer
has WORKED for it.. it's not some level 16 that was powerleveled by his
guild and given tons of cash to go wild with. Every copper I've put into
tinkering has come the hard way, and I'd be a little ticked if a level 16
could undercut my prices because the cap is removed.

I don't like that the cap was unadvertised, and it cost so many people so
much money to discover it. But it only helps those of us who have achieved
level and money the hard way.

Rogue greed, maybe, but my opinion :)

Yilmatin Kylari
37th level gnomish rogue
Follower of the Vicious Lemming
Bertoxxulous


>From: Monica Bradlee <mbradlee@...>
>Reply-To: EQ_Tinkering@onelist.com
>To: EQ_Tinkering@onelist.com
>Subject: [EQ_Tinkering] Tinkering Cap
>Date: Sat, 27 Nov 1999 03:53:44 -0500
>
>I am planning a revolt of sorts on The Innoruuk server after the patch on
>Dec 1st if they do not remove the tinkering cap. I have gotten about 6
>guilds so far to help me with this, we are all going to petition that the
>cap should be removed at the same time with anyone who doesn't have a clue
>having the Guide/Gm refer to me. If anyone else wanted to join in on the
>fun please do I will have a
>better idea what time next week
>
>Efrieum
>34 warrior
>Innorruuk
>
